page.title: 03Brecon Beacons National Park
page.content: The {Brecon Beacons National Park, designed in{1957,} covers {381 square {miles}in Breconshire, 81 square miles in Carmarthenshire and{51 square miles in Monmouthshire. It has great beauty and variety of scenes; including low populated red-sand stone mountains and moorlands, and the limestone foothills and crags,which are cut either by lush valleys which shelter villages and market towns, or by deep wooded gorges. Roads up the{ Wye} and{ Usk {valleys,}bring visitors from the Midlands and South-east England. It offers the vistors a peaceful, largely unspoilt and well -tended contryside. Breconshire has over 150,000 acres of common grazings ,the highest total of any Welsh area. The{Brecon Beacons National Park}is still a beautiful place and hopefuly will be for many years to come.
